abstracts.cdata!:
Project ratings are as follows: Project
            outcome is satisfactory; sustainability is likely;
            institutional development impact is substantial; Bank
            performance is satisfactory; Borrower performance is
            satisfactory. Lessons can be drawn from this project
            regarding 1) the  importance of focusing
            actions/interventions to make a meaningful impact;
            coordinating the interventions of international financial
            institutions to promote better implementation;.3) possible
            difficulties caused by  testing new and alternative
            modalities and programs to help the Borrower identify the
            most suitable option to achieve its sector objectives: too
            many different approaches, often driven by separate
            financier agendas, can contribute to scattered strategies,
            competitive models and increased cost of supervision. 4)
            the greatest impact in reducing maternal and infant
            mortality resulting from working with NGOs and supporting
            community managed Women Centers and community volunteers; 5)
            decentralizing the implementation of changes at local level
            to achieve depth, experience and sustainability of changes;
            6) the need to expand both supply and demand interventions
            equally and simultaneously;7) the importance of coordinating
            the provision of equipment and infrastructure improvement
            with the technical assistance and training at the hospital
            and other providers' levels; and 8) the great impact of
            maternal centers in reducing maternal mortality.
